column3: Initial needs assessments completed and disseminated within 72 hours​ of the event.
column4: Disaster Brief done to inform the FAD between 48-72 h
column5: EA is launched within 24 hours after the FAD has been approved (or within 48 hours after field report was published).
column7: A resource mobilization plan is developed and approved within 2 weeks of the EA
column8: IFRC having the green light from the receiving NS to deploy RR 24h after the disaster
column9: RR personnel Alert sent within 12h of the request
column10: # of RR deployed arriving in country of operation within 4 days from deployment message  - 3 months
column11: Key initial longer-term positions identified by operational leadership and requested via submission in the HR system, one week after the EA publication
column12: Once approved in the HR system and pre-classified JD provided, HR advertises key initial longer-term positions within 48 hours.
column13: Hold a mini summit within 48 h of the disaster
column14: review/adapt membership coordination for the context for this specific emergency
column15: Appropriate membership coordination is in place after 24h of disaster
column16: % implementation rate of available budget - 3 months
column18: If the country is not MSR, enough resource (HR/Funds) have been allocated to operate in a Red/orange security phase areas
